      Determines whether to only return active offer transactions

      Target API Endpoint: /retailer/offer/search

      void updateOffer(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<RetailerOfferResponse> callback)
      Update an offer, must provide a current list of retailer locations or the current offer locations will be marked as deleted.

      Target API Endpoint: /retailer/offer/update

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account used to perform the update, must have rights to edit the offer (deviceId or accountId required) SirqulKeys.offerId
      The offer to update SirqulKeys.retailerLocationIds
      Comma separated list of retailer location ids.
      void updateOfferStatus(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
      Sets the activated date on offers.
      void updateSearchIndex(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
      Updates offer locations that are marked to be saved to index reporting data.

      Target API Endpoint: /offer/location/searchindex/update

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
      The application key - only Sirqul app is allowed SirqulKeys.searchTag
      run for rows that have this "searchTags" value - ignores the "insearchindex" value SirqulKeys.batchCount
      This number of records to process SirqulKeys.maxUpdateSearchIndexRecords
      This maximum records to upload to the AWS search index at once.
      void updateVoucherStatus(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
      Redeems a voucher.

      Target API Endpoint: /retailer/voucher/updatestatus

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required) SirqulKeys.offerTransactionId
      the OfferTransaction ID SirqulKeys.status
      the status to set the offer transaction to - 1 sets it to redeemable and 2 sets it to redeemed
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail

    • Method Detail

      • addOffer

        public void addOffer(Map<String,Object> params,
            ISirqulCallback<RetailerOfferResponse> callback)
        Create an offer and assign it to the provided retailer locations.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/offer/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.retailerLocationIds
          Comma separated list of retailer location ids. This will assign the offer to these retailer locations.
        • SirqulKeys.title
          The title (255 char limit)
        • SirqulKeys.subTitle
          The sub title (255 char limit)
        • SirqulKeys.details
          The details
        • SirqulKeys.subDetails
          A string for custom details (255 char limit)
        • SirqulKeys.finePrint
          The fine print
        • SirqulKeys.barcodeType
          The bar code type {NONE, UPC, CODE_128, QR, CUSTOM_MEDIA}
        • SirqulKeys.barcodeEntry
          The bar code entry string
        • SirqulKeys.externalRedeemAuth
          An external integer identifier. What the identifier will be used for will be up to the frontend developer.
        • SirqulKeys.ticketsReward
          Determines how many tickets are awarded
        • SirqulKeys.activated
          The date of when the offer will be visible to consumers
        • SirqulKeys.expires
          The date of when the offer expires
        • SirqulKeys.noExpiration
          Overrides the expiration date so that the offer does not expire
        • SirqulKeys.availableLimit
          The limit of how many times the offer can be used by consumers
        • SirqulKeys.availableLimitPerUser
          The limit of how many times a user can used the same offer
        • SirqulKeys.viewLimit
          The limit of how many times the offer can be viewed
        • SirqulKeys.maxPrints
          The maximum number of times the offer can be printed
        • SirqulKeys.ticketPrice
          The cost of the offer in tickets
        • SirqulKeys.fullPrice
          The retail/full price cost of the offer in real currency
        • SirqulKeys.discountPrice
          The cost of the offer at a discounted price (what the consumer pays)
        • SirqulKeys.showRemaining
          The show remaining
        • SirqulKeys.showRedeemed
          The show redeemed
        • SirqulKeys.replaced
          The replaced
        • SirqulKeys.featured
          The featured
        • SirqulKeys.offerType
          The offer type {VOUCHER, COUPON, PRODUCT, EVENT, MEDIA}
        • SirqulKeys.specialOfferType
          The special offer type {ALL, REGULAR_OFFER, ACT_NOW, GET_THERE_NOW, SQOOT, TICKETS, YIPIT}
        • SirqulKeys.offerVisibility
          The offer visibility {PUBLIC, ALL_MISSIONS, MY_MISISONS}
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          Comma separated list of category ids
        • SirqulKeys.filterIds
          Comma separated list of filter ids
        • SirqulKeys.active
          Sets the active flag
        • SirqulKeys.barcodeAssetId
          The id of the barcode asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId1
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId2
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId3
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId4
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId5
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.publisher
          The maker of the item.
        • SirqulKeys.redeemableStart
          The redeemable start date/time of the offer.
        • SirqulKeys.redeemableEnd
          The redeemable start date/time of the offer.
        • SirqulKeys.brand
          The brand. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.productType
          The product type. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.conditionType
          The condition. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.isbn
          The ISBN id. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.asin
          The ASIN id. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.catalogNumbers
          The list of catelog numbers, comma seperated. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.department
          The department name. The OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.features
          The list of features, comma seperated. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.minimumPrice
          The MAP price. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.width
          The width of the item. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.height
          The height of the item. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.depth
          The depth of the item. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.weight
          The weight of the item. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.unit
          The unit of measurement. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.studio
          The studio name. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.parentalRating
          The parental control rating. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.publishDate
          The date published. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.availabilityDate
          The date available. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.sizeId
          The size Id. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.listingId
          The ID of the event listing
        • SirqulKeys.duration
          The total playing time of the media item. OfferType MEDIA only.
        • SirqulKeys.author
          The created/author of the media item. OfferType MEDIA only.
        • SirqulKeys.releaseDate
          The date/time of when the media item was originally released. OfferType MEDIA only.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        RetailerOfferResponse on success, SirqulResponse on failure with message.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        OfferApiBase.addOffer(...)

        public void getOffer(Map<String,Object> params,
            ISirqulCallback<RetailerOfferResponse> callback)

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/offer/get

      • getOfferDetails

        public void getOfferDetails(Map<String,Object> params,
                   ISirqulCallback<OfferResponse> callback)
        Gets offer or offer location details as a consumer. Will check if it is a favorite if the deviceId/accountId is provided. If the offerId is provided it will look up the main offer and ignore the the offerLocationId. If no offerId is provided then an offerLocationId must be specified.

        Target API Endpoint: /offer/get

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id for returning account information (i.e. favorites)
        • SirqulKeys.offerId
          The offer id (either offeLocationId or offerId must be provided)
        • SirqulKeys.offerLocationId
          The offer location id (either offeLocationId or offerId must be provided)
        • SirqulKeys.distance
          The distance of the offer from the user's current location (this is returned when the offer is searched)
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          The location to calculate distance from the offer

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        OfferResponse on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        OfferApiBase.getOfferDetails

      • getOfferLocationsForRetailers

        public void getOfferLocationsForRetailers(Map<String,Object> params,
                                 ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<OfferShortResponse>> callback)
        Searches on offer locations, which are records that represent an offer that has been assigned to a retailer location. If an offer does not have any locations assigned, then it will NOT be returned.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/offer/location/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search
        • SirqulKeys.retailerId
          Filter results for a specific retailer
        • SirqulKeys.retailerLocationId
          Filter results for a specific retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.offerType
          Filter results to only return COUPON, VOUCHER, PRODUCT, MEDIA, or EVENT offers
        • SirqulKeys.specialOfferType
          Filter results to only return REGULAR_OFFER, ACT_NOW, GET_THERE_NOW, SQOOT, or TICKETS offer specials
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The column to sort the results on. Default is "TITLE", which will sort the results by the offer title. Possible input values: {CREATED, UPDATED, ACTIVE, ACTIVATED, EXPIRES, TITLE, SUBTITLE, DETAILS, OFFER_TYPE, RETAILER_ID, RETAILER_LOCATION_ID, BILLABLE_ENTITY_NAME, RESPONSIBLE_DISPLAY}
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          The order to return the results. Default is false, which will return the results in ascending order.
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The index into the record set to start with. Default is 0.
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The total number of records to return. Default is 20.
        • SirqulKeys.activeOnly
          Determines whether to return only active results. Default is false.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse<OfferShortResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        OfferApiBase.getOfferLocationsForRetailers

      • getOffersList

        public void getOffersList(Map<String,Object> params,
                 ISirqulCallback<OfferListResponse> callback)
        Gets the offers list.

        Target API Endpoint: /offer/lists

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id for returning account information (i.e. offer transactions made by the user)
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location of where the search will center at
        • SirqulKeys.searchRange
          the range of the search
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          the keyword to filter results by
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          list of category ids to filter by
        • SirqulKeys.filters
          list of filter ids
        • SirqulKeys.offerTypes
          Comma separated list of offer types {COUPON, VOUCHER, PRODUCT, MEDIA, EVENT}
        • SirqulKeys.type
          The special offer type {ALL, REGULAR_OFFER, ACT_NOW, GET_THERE_NOW, SQOOT, TICKETS, YIPIT}
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The field to sort the result set on {DISTANCE, BUSINESS_NAME}
        • SirqulKeys.locationId
          Only return offers for the specific retailer location.
        • SirqulKeys.includeMission
          If true include the mission response as part of the offer. Default is false.
        • SirqulKeys.start
          the start index for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          the limit for pagination

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a OfferListResponse containing offers list on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        OfferApiBase.getOffersList

      • getOfferTransactionsForRetailer

        public void getOfferTransactionsForRetailer(Map<String,Object> params,
                                   ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<OfferShortResponse>> callback)
        Searches on offer transactions for offers that the account has access to.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/offer/transaction/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword to search for
        • SirqulKeys.retailerId
          Filter results for this retailer
        • SirqulKeys.retailerLocationId
          Filter results for this retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.offerId
          Filter results for this offer
        • SirqulKeys.offerLocationId
          Filter results for this offer location
        • SirqulKeys.redeemed
          if true return redeemed transactions (status 2), if false return active transactions (status 0 or 1)
        • SirqulKeys.offerType
          Filter results to only return COUPON or VOUCHER offers
        • SirqulKeys.specialOfferType
          Filter results to only return REGULAR_OFFER, ACT_NOW, GET_THERE_NOW, SQOOT, or TICKETS offer specials
        • SirqulKeys.customerAccountIds
          Filter results by accounts
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          Determines what to sort the results by {CREATED, UPDATED, SEARCH_TAGS, ACTIVE, ACTIVATED, EXPIRES, TITLE, SUBTITLE, OFFER_TYPE, SPECIAL_OFFER_TYPE, OFFER_VISIBILITY, COUPON_TYPE, CUSTOMER_ID, CUSTOMER_DISPLAY, RETAILER_ID, RETAILER_NAME, RETAILER_LOCATION_ID, RETAILER_LOCATION_NAME, BILLABLE_ENTITY_ID, BILLABLE_ENTITY_NAME, RESPONSIBLE_DISPLAY}
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          Determines whether the results are in descending order
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The start index for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The limit for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.activeOnly
          Determines whether to only return active offer transactions

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse<OfferShortResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

      • getTopOfferTransactions

        public void getTopOfferTransactions(Map<String,Object> params,
                           ISirqulCallback<OfferListResponse> callback)
        Gets the top active offers.

        Target API Endpoint: /offer/top

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The index into the record set to start with. Default is 0.
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The total number of record to return. Default is 20.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        OfferListResponse if valid, otherwise SirqulResponse
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        OfferApiBase.getTopOfferTransactions

      • removeOffer

        public void removeOffer(Map<String,Object> params,
               ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Set the deleted timestamp to current time. This effectively deletes the offer since all queries should ignore any records with a deleted time stamp.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/offer/delete

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account used to perform the delete, must have rights to edit the offer.
        • SirqulKeys.offerId
          The ID of the offer to be deleted

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        OfferApiBase.removeOffer

      • searchOffersForRetailers

        public void searchOffersForRetailers(Map<String,Object> params,
                            ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<OfferShortResponse>> callback)
        Get and searches on offers that the account has access to.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/offer/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search
        • SirqulKeys.retailerId
          the retailer id
        • SirqulKeys.retailerLocationId
          the retailer location id
        • SirqulKeys.offerType
          Filter results to only return COUPON or VOUCHER offers
        • SirqulKeys.specialOfferType
          Filter results to only return REGULAR_OFFER, ACT_NOW, GET_THERE_NOW, SQOOT, or TICKETS offer specials,
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The column to sort the search on, Enums.OfferApiMap
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          determines whether the sorted list is in descending or ascending order
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The record to begin the return set on
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The number of records to return
        • SirqulKeys.activeOnly
          Return only active results

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse of RetailerLocationResponse on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response Enums.CouponType Enums.SpecialOfferType
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        OfferApiBase.searchOffersForRetailers

      • updateOffer

        public void updateOffer(Map<String,Object> params,
               ISirqulCallback<RetailerOfferResponse> callback)
        Update an offer, must provide a current list of retailer locations or the current offer locations will be marked as deleted.

        Target API Endpoint: /retailer/offer/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account used to perform the update, must have rights to edit the offer (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.offerId
          The offer to update
        • SirqulKeys.retailerLocationIds
          Comma separated list of retailer location ids. This will assign the offer to these retailer locations.
        • SirqulKeys.title
          The title (255 char limit)
        • SirqulKeys.subTitle
          The sub title (255 char limit)
        • SirqulKeys.details
          The details
        • SirqulKeys.subDetails
          A string for custom details (255 char limit)
        • SirqulKeys.finePrint
          The fine print
        • SirqulKeys.barcodeType
          The bar code type {NONE, UPC, CODE_128, QR, CUSTOM_MEDIA}
        • SirqulKeys.barcodeEntry
          The bar code entry string
        • SirqulKeys.externalRedeemAuth
          An external integer identifier. What the identifier will be used for will be up to the frontend developer.
        • SirqulKeys.ticketsReward
          Determines how many tickets are awarded
        • SirqulKeys.activated
          The date of when the offer will be visible to consumers
        • SirqulKeys.expires
          The date of when the offer expires
        • SirqulKeys.noExpiration
          Overrides the expiration date so that the offer does not expire
        • SirqulKeys.availableLimit
          The limit of how many times the offer can be used by consumers
        • SirqulKeys.availableLimitPerUser
          The limit of how many times a user can used the same offer
        • SirqulKeys.viewLimit
          the view limit
        • SirqulKeys.maxPrints
          The maximum number of times the offer can be printed
        • SirqulKeys.ticketPrice
          The cost of the offer in tickets
        • SirqulKeys.fullPrice
          The retail/full price cost of the offer in real currency
        • SirqulKeys.discountPrice
          The cost of the offer at a discounted price (what the consumer pays)
        • SirqulKeys.showRemaining
          The show remaining
        • SirqulKeys.showRedeemed
          The show redeemed
        • SirqulKeys.replaced
          The replaced
        • SirqulKeys.featured
          The featured
        • SirqulKeys.offerType
          The offer type {VOUCHER, COUPON, PRODUCT, MEDIA, EVENT}
        • SirqulKeys.specialOfferType
          The special offer type {ALL, REGULAR_OFFER, ACT_NOW, GET_THERE_NOW, SQOOT, TICKETS, YIPIT}
        • SirqulKeys.offerVisibility
          The offer visibility {PUBLIC, ALL_MISSIONS, MY_MISISONS}
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          Comma separated list of category ids
        • SirqulKeys.filterIds
          Comma separated list of filter ids
        • SirqulKeys.active
          Sets the active flag
        • SirqulKeys.barcodeAssetId
          The id of the barcode asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId1
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId2
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId3
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId4
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.imageAssetId5
          The id of the an offer asset
        • SirqulKeys.publisher
          The maker of the item.
        • SirqulKeys.redeemableStart
          The redeemable start date/time of the offer.
        • SirqulKeys.redeemableEnd
          The redeemable start date/time of the offer.
        • SirqulKeys.brand
          The brand. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.productType
          The product type. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.conditionType
          The condition. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.isbn
          The ISBN id. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.asin
          The ASIN id. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.catalogNumbers
          The list of catelog numbers, comma seperated. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.department
          The department name. The OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.features
          The list of features, comma seperated. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.minimumPrice
          The MAP price. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.width
          The width of the item. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.height
          The height of the item. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.depth
          The depth of the item. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.weight
          The weight of the item. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.unit
          The unit of measurement. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.studio
          The studio name. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.parentalRating
          The parental control rating. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.publishDate
          The date published. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.availabilityDate
          The date available. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.sizeId
          The size Id. OfferType PRODUCT only.
        • SirqulKeys.listingId
          The ID of the event listing
        • SirqulKeys.duration
          The total playing time of the media item. OfferType MEDIA only.
        • SirqulKeys.author
          The created/author of the media item. OfferType MEDIA only.
        • SirqulKeys.releaseDate
          The date/time of when the media item was originally released. OfferType MEDIA only.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        RetailerOfferResponse on success, or SirqulResponse with error message.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        OfferApiBase.updateOffer

      • updateSearchIndex

        public void updateSearchIndex(Map<String,Object> params,
                     ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Updates offer locations that are marked to be saved to index reporting data.

        Target API Endpoint: /offer/location/searchindex/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key - only Sirqul app is allowed
        • SirqulKeys.searchTag
          run for rows that have this "searchTags" value - ignores the "insearchindex" value
        • SirqulKeys.batchCount
          This number of records to process
        • SirqulKeys.maxUpdateSearchIndexRecords
          This maximum records to upload to the AWS search index at once. AWS Search has a 5MB limit for submissions so setting this too high will cause this to error out. Keep in mind that this is either the total number of RetailerLocations OR Offers since the RetailerLocation and Offer indices are updated at the same time. So the first one to reach 1000 records will trigger the save for both.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        OfferApiBase.updateSearchIndex
